alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 29 at 9:15AM EDT until June 29 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Warrick County in southwestern Indiana... Southeastern Gibson County in southwestern Indiana... Southern Pike County in southwestern Indiana... * Until 900 AM CDT/1000 AM EDT/. * At 815 AM CDT/915 AM EDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located near Oakland City, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Oakland City, Winslow, Somerville, Spurgeon and Mackey. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 26 and 40. Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 49 and 51. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
